thread.title: Piers Morgan: The Media Is 'Absolutely Determined' To Bring Down Trump
thread.title_full: Piers Morgan: The Media Is 'Absolutely Determined' To Bring Down Trump

title: Piers Morgan: The Media Is 'Absolutely Determined' To Bring Down Trump

organizations.name: america first suicide bomber strikes afghanistan’s supreme court

text:
Former CNN anchor Piers Morgan told Tucker Carlson on Monday that the media is “absolutely determined” to bring down President Trump.
“I think some of them absolutely are [determined to take him down],” said Morgan, the current editor-at-large for the Daily Mail Online, during his appearance on Fox News Channel. “They were in the tank for Hillary Clinton, their candidate.”
His advice to liberals in the media who are still upset at Trump’s election? “Stop trying to delegitimize him,” Morgan said. “Stop trying to make every tweet, every statement, every comment he says the Armageddon of the world.”
 
Related Stories Trump Releases List Of Terror Attacks ‘Dishonest’ Media ‘Ignored’ As Democrats Delay, GOP Seeks To Pick Up Pace Of Cabinet Confirmations Two Super Bowl Champs Now Refusing To Attend White House Celebratory Visit Morgan said there is a “ war ” between the media and the White House unlike anything he has ever seen before, and added that it is “pretty rich” for the press to attack Trump, citing their conduct toward Trump during the presidential election.
Morgan brought up prickly relationship between the New York Times and Trump last year.
Trump criticized the Times for its coverage of his election campaign, and referred to the paper as a “failing” enterprise. It resulted in a meeting between the president and the publication’s editorial board shortly after the election that has not resulted in any lasting peace between the two sides.
 
“I think that there is fault on both sides here,” said Morgan, on the situation. “I think that it is dangerous and toxic.”

Carlson asked Morgan about his own experiences working for CNN and whether there was a “special connection between CNN” and the Democratic party.
“To be honest, and to be fair to CNN, I think the vast majority of people who work there, particularly the anchors, have great integrity,” Morgan answered. “I don’t think they would want to be party to any of this kind of stuff.”
 
Trending Stories Pelosi: Trump’s Actions ‘Not Grounds For Impeachment’ W.Va. Senator Calls On Democrats To Put America First Suicide Bomber Strikes Afghanistan’s Supreme Court, Killing At Least 20 . @piersmorgan : It is dangerous & toxic. Media has to show @realDonaldTrump a bit more respect & he has to show the media some respect -TCT
— Tucker Carlson (@TuckerCarlson) February 7, 2017 

That being said, Morgan noted “there were people lower down the food chain, perhaps, who didn’t have such scruples and who were absolutely determined that Trump wouldn’t win.”
The former CNN talk show host parted ways with the network in 2014.
What do you think?
